name: TheAtlantic
text: "The independence of the Supreme Court’s conservative majority is affirmed, while still granting the president the outcome he desired," @AdamSerwer writes: https://t.co/zRkQWGvS8O

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Alabama Democrat Doug Jones knows that the fight for civil rights is a long one. But he's optimistic about the future, he tells @IsaacDovere.
https://t.co/awR9D0DlSj

name: TheAtlantic
text: Like the one-child policy, Beijing’s repressive actions against minority Uighur Muslims are about preserving power. As @meifongwriter writes, China's birth-control policies were always less about births, more about control. https://t.co/Ngq5lnbH5O

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Simply giving people cash turns out to be a powerful way to protect workers during a public-health crisis, to alleviate poverty, and to empower employees to bargain with employers. Uncle Sam needs to give out a lot more," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/W04l38hEpg

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The more significant effect of Mazars and Vance was always going to be on the level of institutions rather than individuals—the positioning of the presidency in relation to Congress and state law enforcement," @qjurecic writes: https://t.co/dRQsDGPT5R

name: TheAtlantic
text: As another week closes, America isn’t any closer to regaining control over this outbreak. Let’s recap four things we learned while reporting on the pandemic. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/Y70vN0nNjv

name: TheAtlantic
text: That the president’s reprieve for his friend Roger Stone was predictable makes it no less brazen, writes @RussellBerman: https://t.co/uOhSgNfwVV

name: TheAtlantic
text: Donald Trump, the man, lost at the Supreme Court. But Donald Trump, the candidate, can claim victory. Our writers explain in the latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/jN9nmtoMzY

name: TheAtlantic
text: "How did the Golden State manage to screw things up after such a promising start? California’s experience shows that doing the right thing matters—but gives you no special privilege when you stop doing it," @Bob_Wachter writes: https://t.co/ULt9K7knaf

name: TheAtlantic
text: Ominous statues in Thailand, solar boats in the Netherlands, the empty streets of Pamplona, a zoo re-opening in Ecuador, a nuclear power plant in France, and much more—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/qQB8BZAWDh

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Rather than thinking of abolition as just getting rid of police, I think about it as an invitation to create and support lots of different answers to the problem of harm in society," @dereckapurnell writes: https://t.co/9vMLJWWTrq

name: TheAtlantic
text: For "The Friendship Files," @julieebeck talks with @aminatou and @annfriedman, the hosts of the “Call Your Girlfriend” podcast and authors of “Big Friendship,” about their very public friendship and how couples therapy saved it: https://t.co/dWg4yL3vct

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Rather than thinking of abolition as just getting rid of police, I think about it as an invitation to create and support lots of different answers to the problem of harm in society," @dereckapurnell writes: https://t.co/IvU80UtI4X

name: TheAtlantic
text: "It is hard for many people to wrap their mind around the fact that Union Army soldiers fought to wrest Native lands away from multiple tribes, as part of the Union cause to create a free, white West," @megankatenelson writes: https://t.co/MWSN4q4aUO

name: TheAtlantic
text:
The Fox News host Tucker Carlson has renewed his attacks on Senator Tammy Duckworth's patriotism.

Duckworth, a veteran, double amputee, and potential VP pick, is eager to challenge the idea that the military is a monolith of white male conservatives: https://t.co/DuFNd79DTj

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen: @helenlewis joins @katlwells and @jameshamblin to discuss the plans to reopen schools in the fall. https://t.co/7nfyeUqTDm

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Dissonance is most painful when evidence strikes at the heart of how we see ourselves—when it threatens our belief that we are kind, ethical, competent, or smart," writes Elliot Aronson and Carol Tavris: https://t.co/FQIbYKpIYP
